metadata.title: 7 Best Onion Recipes | Onion Pakodi, Korma, Rings, Chutney, Pulusu | Vismai Food
metadata.description: A compilation of 7 delicious onion-based recipes including Crispy Onion Pakodi, Onion Korma, Onion Rings, Onion Chutney, Onion Pulusu, Onion Coconut Chutney, and Soft Onion Pakodi (Gatti Pakodi).

transcription_telugu: [00:00] హలో ఫుడీస్, విస్మయి ఫుడ్‌కు స్వాగతం.
[00:01] ఇవాళ అత్యంత రుచికరమైన స్నాక్ — ఉల్లిపాయ పకోడీ ఎలా తయారు చేయాలో చూపిస్తాను.
[00:10] దీన్నే గట్టి పకోడీ అని కూడా అంటారు.
[00:12] పర్ఫెక్ట్ స్వీట్ షాప్ స్టైల్ రెసిపీ ఇది.
[00:15] చాలా క్రిస్పీగా, క్రంచీగా చాలా చాలా బాగుంటాయి. లెట్స్ స్టార్ట్.
[00:20] ముందుగా 300 గ్రాముల ఉల్లిపాయలను తొక్క తీసి, అర్ధంగా కట్ చేసి, నిలువుగా మరీ సన్నగా కాకుండా తరిగి పెట్టుకోండి.
[00:35] ఇప్పుడు నాలుగు పచ్చిమిర్చులను చీల్చి పక్కన పెట్టుకోండి.
[00:42] ఇప్పుడు మిక్సింగ్ బౌల్‌లో ఉల్లిపాయలు, పచ్చిమిర్చులు, ఉప్పు, ఒక టేబుల్ స్పూన్ కారం, ఒక టేబుల్ స్పూన్ తాజా గా రుబ్బుకున్న అల్లం వెల్లుల్లి ముద్ద వేయండి.
[00:53] ఒక టీ స్పూన్ వేయించిన జీలకర్ర పొడి, ఒక టీ స్పూన్ ధనియాల పొడి, ఒక టీ స్పూన్ జీలకర్ర, ఒక టీ స్పూన్ ధనియాలు బాగా క్రష్ చేసి వేయండి.
[01:06] వీటన్నిటిని ఉల్లిపాయలను బాగా ఒత్తుతూ గట్టిగా కలపండి.
[01:13] ఉల్లిపాయలకు సరిపడా — అంటే 150 గ్రాముల సెనగపిండి, రెండు టేబుల్ స్పూన్లు బియ్యం పిండి వేసుకోండి.
[01:20] ముందుగా ఈ పిండంతా ఉల్లిపాయలకు పట్టేలా పొడి పొడిగా పైకి కిందకి కలపండి.
[01:26] ఆ తర్వాత కొంచెం ప్రెషర్ ఇస్తూ గట్టిగా కలపండి.
[01:30] ఇప్పుడు కేవలం ఒక టేబుల్ స్పూన్ నీళ్లు మాత్రమే వేసి పిండిని కలపండి.
[01:36] ఉల్లిపాయల నుంచి వచ్చే నీరే సరిపోతుంది. కొంచెం ముద్దలా రావాలి కాబట్టి అంతే నీళ్లు చాలు.
[01:46] ఇప్పుడు బాగా వేడెక్కిన నూనెలో కొంచెం ముద్దను చేతుల్లోకి తీసుకుని, వేళ్లతో పొడి పొడిగా వేసుకుంటూ వేయండి.
[01:56] ఈ పకోడీలను మీడియం ఫ్లేమ్‌పై క్రిస్పీగా వేయించండి.
[02:09] 95% వేగాక దింపేయండి. బయటకు తీసిన తర్వాత వేడి వల్ల ఉల్లిపాయలు మరింత మృదువుగా అవుతాయి.
[02:15] పకోడీలు వేయించాక, రెండు రెబ్బల కరివేపాకు వేసి వేయించి పక్కన పెట్టుకోండి.
[02:27] వేయించిన కరివేపాకును పకోడీల మీద చల్లండి.
transcription_english: [00:00] Hello Foodies, Welcome to Vismai Food.
[00:01] Today I will show you how to make the most yummiest snack, Onion Pakodi.
[00:10] This is also called Gatti Pakodi (Hard Pakoda).
[00:12] This is a perfect sweet shop style recipe.
[00:15] They will be very crispy and crunchy. Let's start.
[00:20] First, peel 300 grams of onion, cut into half, and slice them lengthwise but not too thin.
[00:35] Now slit four green chillies and keep aside.
[00:42] Now in a mixing bowl, add onions, green chillies, salt, one tablespoon chilli powder, one tablespoon freshly ground ginger garlic paste.
[00:53] Add one teaspoon roasted cumin powder, one teaspoon coriander powder, one teaspoon cumin seeds, and one teaspoon crushed coriander seeds.
[01:06] Squeeze the onions tightly while mixing everything together.
[01:13] Add exactly half the amount of onions, which is 150 grams of chickpea flour (besan), and two tablespoons of rice flour.
[01:20] First, toss the onions up and down so the flour coats them well.
[01:26] Then apply some pressure and mix tightly.
[01:30] Now add just one tablespoon of water, that's it, and mix the dough tightly.
[01:36] The moisture from the onions is enough for this. We add water just to bind it a little.
[01:46] Now take small portions of the dough into your hand and drop them into piping hot oil loosely with your fingers.
[01:56] Fry this pakodi on medium flame until crispy.
[02:09] Remove when 95% fried. The onions will cook further with the heat after taking them out.
[02:15] After frying the pakodi, fry two sprigs of curry leaves and keep them aside.
[02:27] Sprinkle the fried curry leaves over the pakodi.
[02:39] Hey Foodies, Welcome to Vismai Food. Today's spicy recipe is Onion Korma.
[02:57] Heat one teaspoon oil in a kadai, add sliced onions and fry until the raw smell goes and they turn golden color.
[03:07] After they are almost 60% fried, add two tablespoons of cashews, two tablespoons of dry coconut powder and fry on low flame.
[03:14] After it changes color, add one tablespoon sesame seeds, fry until they pop and let it cool.
[03:20] Transfer this cooled mixture into a jar, add some water and make a fine paste.
[03:28] Now heat three tablespoons of oil in a kadai, add one tablespoon ginger garlic paste, salt, half teaspoon garam masala, two pinches of turmeric...
[03:37] Add one tablespoon chilli powder, one teaspoon coriander powder, one teaspoon roasted cumin powder and fry the masala well.
[03:47] Once the oil separates, add two tomatoes paste and mix well, add large onion petals from one big onion and cook on medium flame.
[04:02] Once onions are cooked well, add a quarter cup of tamarind juice and cook until oil separates.
[04:09] Only after oil separates, add the ground onion paste, mix well, add 200ml water and cook on low flame.
[04:22] While boiling, a foam will form on top, remove that foam, the curry will look very good.
[04:30] Add some coriander leaves along with stems, mix well, and cook on low flame until the curry thickens and oil floats on top. That's it, Curry Ready.
[04:50] Today's special is Onion Rings. This is a perfect snack.
[05:05] First, add half a cup of maida to a bowl. Add a little salt, and add rings sliced from a large onion.
[05:19] Place a plate on the bowl and toss well so the maida coats the onions well.
[05:24] Now sprinkle some water and toss again. Then the maida will stick to the onions even better.
[05:32] Now take all the onion rings onto a plate...
[05:38] Into the remaining maida, add two tablespoons corn flour, half teaspoon pepper powder, and half teaspoon garlic powder.
[05:48] Add water and mix the batter to a flowing consistency.
[05:57] Now dip the onion rings in the mixed batter and coat well with bread crumbs two or three times.
[06:22] Now drop them in hot oil and fry on medium-high heat for two to three minutes.
[06:31] Remove as soon as they turn light golden color. That's it, Ready.
[06:48] Today's special is Onion Chutney. It tastes very good if made in this style.
[06:59] Heat two tablespoons oil in a kadai, add one tablespoon mustard seeds, one teaspoon cumin seeds, quarter cup urad dal and roast well.
[07:11] Now add 6-7 dry red chillies, four green chillies and fry well for three to four minutes. Cool down after frying.
[07:23] Now in the same kadai, add chopped onions from three big onions, add one tablespoon oil, and fry on medium flame for 4-5 minutes until raw smell goes.
[07:34] After raw smell goes, add lemon-sized tamarind and roast for another two minutes and let it cool.
[07:42] Now add the cooled mustard and dry chillies to a jar and make a fine powder.
[07:52] Now add the fried onions and salt, and make a fine paste.
[08:00] Now heat two tablespoons oil, add half teaspoon mustard seeds, a pinch of hing, two sprigs of curry leaves and fry well, mix this tempering into the onion chutney, that's it.
[08:32] Hello Foodies, Welcome to Vismai Food. Today's special is The Best Onion Pulusu (Stew).
[08:50] First soak 50 grams tamarind in hot water, extract the juice and keep aside.
[08:56] Now heat three tablespoons oil in a pan, add two sliced regular onions, and 10 to 12 sambar onions.
[09:07] After they soften a bit, add salt, one teaspoon chilli powder, mix well, cover and cook the onions only on medium flame.
[09:23] After onions are cooked well, add 300ml tamarind juice. Add another 300ml water, half teaspoon turmeric, 50 grams jaggery...
[09:35] Add three slit green chillies, mix well, and let it boil on low flame for 15 minutes.
[09:49] After 15 minutes, add 50ml water to one teaspoon rice flour and mix without lumps.
[09:58] After mixing, pour it slowly into the boiling stew, mix well, cover and boil for another three to four minutes.
[10:09] Now sprinkle two tablespoons chopped coriander, mix well and set aside.
[10:14] Now heat two tablespoons oil, add one teaspoon fenugreek seeds, and let them fry more than half.

[10:20] After frying, add one teaspoon mustard seeds and let them splutter. After spluttering add one teaspoon cumin, two dry chillies, a sprig of curry leaves and fry well, add a pinch of hing too...
[10:35] Add the tempering to the stew. That's it, You are Done.
[10:55] Hello My Dear Foodies, Welcome to Vismai Food. Today let's learn how to make Onion Coconut Chutney.
[11:03] For this, heat half teaspoon oil, add 6 garlic pods.
[11:11] Add two green chillies, two large chopped onions and saute for a while.
[11:19] Add a sprig of curry leaves, one teaspoon cumin seeds, one cup fresh coconut pieces and saute for two minutes...
[11:31] Take into a jar, add salt, add some water and make a fine paste, that's it.
[11:50] Hey Foodies, Welcome to Vismai Food. Today's special is Simple yet Tasty Onion Curry Leaves Soft Pakodi.

[12:11] First in a mixer jar, add one large chopped onion, three chopped green chillies, half teaspoon cumin, one tablespoon tamarind, salt, quarter teaspoon turmeric, half bunch coriander leaves with stems and make a fine paste.
[12:27] Now for pakodi batter, add one cup besan (gram flour), quarter cup rice flour, add water and mix the batter like bajji batter.
[12:37] Now add quarter teaspoon soda, the smoothly ground onion-chilli paste, two bunches of mature curry leaves and mix well.
[12:51] Now drop them like pakodis in hot oil. Fry these pakodis on medium to high flame.
